required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Performance of a Sustained Vacuum System
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Randomized, Prospective Study to Evaluate the Performance of a Sustained Vacuum System

collaborator.agency: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the performance of the SOMAVAC® 100 Sustained Vacuum System after oncologic resections.

primary_outcome.description: Determine the length of time drains were used
Evaluate the number of surgical site related complication

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient reported usability of the suction device
secondary_outcome.description: Determine patient reported usability of the suction device with the system usability scale
Determine the total amount of fluid collected

arm_group.description: All participants receive the SOMAVAC® 100 Sustained Vacuum System

intervention.description: The SOMAVAC® 100 is a battery operated device that delivers 100mm/Hg of continuous suction.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

facility.name: University of Tennessee Heath Science Center
